title: Moscon 1
description: A program book for the first MosCon in 1979. Guests of Honor: Verna Smith Trestrail and Alex Schomburg. Fan Guest of Honor: Jessica Amanda Salmonson. This program includes biographies of Verna Smith Trestrail, Edward E. Smith, Ph.D, Alex Schomburg, and Jessica Amanda Salmonson; appreciations for Clifford D. Simak, L. Sprague de Camp, and Frederik Pohl; and a special tribute entitled "LARGER THAN LIFE A Memoir in Tribute to Dr. Edward E. Smith" by Robert A. Heinlein.

title: Moscon II
description: A program book for the second MosCon in 1980. Guests of Honor: Jerry Sohl, George Barr, and Frank Denton. This year's program is respectfully dedicated to E.E. "Doc"  Smith. Acknowledgements are due to the following people for their help:(In no particular order) Alex Schomburg, George Barr, Jerry Sohl, Jack Gaughan, Bea Taylor, Beth Finkbiner, Victoria Mitchell, Victoria Poyser, Bob Suto, Verna Smith Trestrail, and every one of the people who gave generously of their time and/or talent to help keep MosCon alive and to make it a good con.

title: MosCon X
description: A special extended program book for the tenth anniversary Moscon in 1988. Guests of Honor: Anne McCaffrey; Lela Dowling; Ken Macklin; Robert L. Forward; Ed and Norma Beauregard. Special thanks to the Telgar Weyr of Spokane, and to all the wonderful volunteers who have made this convention not only possible, but a resounding success. And we would like to thank all the previous committee members of MosCon, without whose tireless efforts this convention would not be nearly as good as it is. Thank you all.

title: 1985 Team MosCon Headband
description: A red and white cloth headband that reads "Team MosCon" in English and "Cold Water Patrol" in Japanese. From the MosCon VII (1985) booklet, p. 15: "Overflowing as we are with new and innovative ideas, we actually accomplished one this year. Instead of the standard t-shirt or towel, we have, in limited supply, Team MosCon headbands. We chose headbands in part to provide our membership with a handy place to attach their nametags while in the jacuzzi, and also as a  method of identifying the Con-com. (Ours are blue.) The idea was inspired by the film, Buckaroo Banzai. The Team MosCon logo was designed by Jacqualynn Duram and the Japanese was caligraphed by Ellen Thisted. The Japanese is pronounced, "Tsumetai mizu patororu-tai" and means "Cold Water Patrol." Get one quick. There will be a limited number of them for sale at the registration table."
creator: Jacqualynn Duram; Ellen Thisted
feature_subjects: clothing; souvenirs; Buckaroo Banzai; Jacuzzi Party

title: MosCon XVI T-Shirt
description: The official MosCon XVI shirt, depicting a man in a cape riding a horse in front of a castle. The shirt was manufactured by Chameleon Products in Moscow, ID, and was screenprinted using thermochromatic ink that changed color based on temperature.

title: Towel - Fannish Armada
description: A yellow towel with a circle bordering an image of a sailor in a crow's nest holding a hand held telescope with clouds in the background. The clouds pass out of the border slightly and the text "Moscon 5" is in the lower right corner of the circle. The image separates the bold, black, scrawly text stating "The Fannish Armada," with "The Fannish" on top and "Armada" on the bottom.

title: Button - Registration [1]
description: A yellow, circular button with an illustration of a creature's hand writing with a fountain pen, surrounded by text that reads "Moscon XV Registration / You pays you money, you takes you chances." The quote is possibly referring to the a passage from Aldous Huxley's forward to the 1946 edition of A Brave New World, titled "A Mock Exam": "...or else one supranational totalitarianism, called into existence by the social chaos resulting from rapid technological progress in general and the atomic revolution in particular, and developing, under the need for efficiency and stability, into the welfare-tyranny of Utopia. You pays your money and you takes your choice."
creator: Jon Gustafson
feature_subjects: buttons; souvenirs; illustrations; Registration; MosCon XV
